Dear Ms. Sperling:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 12/09/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the
reevaluation. The placement specifications shall include all
of the following:
(a) Age,
Two of the three current foster home files reviewed contained a reevaluation report
with a different age range recommended than the age range identified in the
corresponding license (3706). The first file was a reevaluation dated 02/12/2021
that recommended an age range of 12-16 years, and the corresponding license was
for an age range of 12-15 years. The second file was a reevaluation dated
02/08/2021 that recommended an age range of 0-5 years, and the corresponding
license was for an age range of 0-4 years.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
worker that has children placed in the home.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation to
indicate the social services worker with children placed in the home was given a
copy of the special evaluation report. The first file had an intake date of 06/25/2021
and a report date of 07/26/2021. The second file had an intake date of 06/29/2021
and a report date of 08/18/2021.
3

R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed corrective
action plan, all social service workers who have children placed
in the home shall be notified there is a corrective action plan
and what is required of the foster parent in that plan.
One of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation the
social services worker with children in the home was notified a corrective action plan
was required and what the corrective action plan required. The intake date of this
special evaluation was 06/25/2021 and the date of the report was 07/26/2021.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of the six current foster child records contained an updated service plan that
was not completed within the time frame required by this rule. In this file the service
plan had a time frame due 10/24/2021 and the completed service plan could not be
located at the time of this review.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
The facility was reminded of the importance of obtaining dated signatures on
required documents within 30 days of the document completion.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. The foster parent had used a little soap in the mouth of the child to correct
inappropriate language. A corrective action plan was required the license has
4

subsequently been closed.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period for the renewal evaluation completed
09/09/2020. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that renewal evaluation
were MCL 722.120, 327(1)(c),(5)(f), 417(1), 405(3), FOM 801, and FOM 722206-H.
None of these areas were identified as repeat noncompliance as a part of this
interim evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment included a review of the previous evaluation
noncompliance and effectiveness of the corrective action plan that was implemented
as determined by subsequent case reviews. It also included additional program
analysis and identification of action steps for ongoing program development.
Interviews
Child welfare staff participated in entrance and exit conferences and individual
interviews did not disclose any concerns.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
